intro: Moraea saxicola, commonly known as the rock moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with contrasting dark veins. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
